content.description: (S facing) Climb the right crack next to the pillar past the roof on the left facing dihedral
content.location: Located on the SE side of Mt Dallymore

content.description: Climb the crescent to gain the vertical crack in the center of the N face
content.location: In the E-W corridor created by Mt Dallymore is a vertical crack in the center of the N face

climbs.name: SGT Klemmer
climbs.fa: Paul and Katie Anderson, Xtian Jones, Lindsay stephens

content.description: Climb the large crack located in the middle of the NW side to climbers left of the seeping crack
content.location: Located on the NW side of Mt Dallymore

content.description: Climb the large flake, traverse, E to gain the water chute. Take the water chute to the summit saddle at which point proceed to the S side for the 15 foot summit face climb
content.location:
The spur is located on the southwestern edge of Mt Dallymore. The route is located on the NW side at the high point in the corridor created by Mt. Dallymore. Located the large boulder at the base of the formation. 

  Location: N 43.8782, W -103.4992

content.description: Take flakes up and right until you can reach the nice long lieback flake. Follow this flake up until its end. Continue straight up until you reach more horizontal cracks which lead you to the right. Gain the big chimney (which appears to be, and perhaps may sometimes be) wet and dirty. Belay in the big cove.
content.protection: Wide variety of cams and nuts (a few extra small cams will put your mind at ease)
content.location: Located 25' to the right of SGT. Klemmer

content.description: A place of great solitude and beauty. Getting there can be a little tricky for your first time. But your work will be rewarded
